name: Random World Facts Quiz / Test | World | 5 Questions

questions.text: What empire finally conquered the empire of Mali in 1335?
questions.explanation:
Songhai.

	It could be argued that, aside from Egypt, the west African empires of Mali and Songhai were the two most powerful in African history.

questions.text: What now stands at ground zero of the atom bomb blast in Hiroshima?
questions.explanation:
Peace Memorial Park.

	The park includes a cenotaph in memory of the victims and nearby Atomic Bomb Dome, the shell of the only building left standing following the blast.

questions.text: What Scott Joplin work, created in 1899, is his most memorable and popular work?
questions.explanation:
Maple Leaf Rag.

	Scott Joplin introduced 'Ragtime' music to America in the late 19th century, a precursor to Jazz (which kicks 'azz', btw!)

questions.text: What term is used in the United States for the festival called 'Fat Tuesday'?
questions.explanation:
Mardi Gras.

	Mardi Gras is best celebrated in the city of New Orleans I am told, at least in the United States!

questions.text: What do Chinese people toss into rivers to commemorate the death of one of their greatest poets Chu Yuan?
questions.explanation:
Sticky rice in lotus leaves.

	Chu Yuan committed suicide by jumping into a river.  The people of China tossed sticky rice balls (called 'zongzi') into the water in order to prevent the fish from eating the great poet.
